seo-description: Construct complex Wikipedia searches easily with a visual interface. Leverage advanced filters and predefined search profiles.
main-heading-disclaimer: This website is not an official Wikipedia product. All search results link directly to Wikipedia.
toast-surprise-me: Surprise! A random topic has been selected.
normal-search-description: Create complex Wikipedia search queries with advanced filters. Combine multiple search terms, filter by categories, file types, date ranges, and geographic locations. Perfect for precise, targeted research.
network-search-description: Enter one or more search terms. The system analyzes Wikipedia articles and displays their relationships and connections as a network graph. This helps you discover thematic connections and categories.
trip-search-description: Enter a destination to get tourist-relevant information from Wikipedia. Discover attractions, history, and more for your next trip.
map-explanation: This map shows the locations of the search results.
map-no-data: No geographical information available for these results.
heatmap-explanation: This visualization shows the most common categories of the search results.
heatmap-no-data: No category data available for these results.
info-main-query: Enter your terms here. The tool will automatically combine them for Wikipedia search.
info-all-words-text: Enter words separated by spaces. The tool finds pages containing ALL of these words.
info-exact-phrase-text: Enter the sequence without quotes. The tool adds them for you automatically.
info-without-words-text: Enter words to exclude. No need to add a minus sign (-).
label-any-words: At least one of these words (OR):
info-any-words-text: Finds pages containing at least one of these terms. Just separate them with a space.
info-wildcard-text: Allows searching for word parts (e.g. 'comput*' finds computer, computing). Note: Cannot be combined with Fuzzy Search for the same term.
info-fuzzy-text: Finds terms even with typos or similar spellings. Example: 'house~' also finds houses or mouse.
info-filesize-text: Filters media files by their size. Use Min and Max for a range.
info-namespaces-text: Select specific Wikipedia namespaces to search within.
label-target-wiki-lang: Target Wiki Language (Search terms must be in the target language):
info-target-lang-text: Selects the language of the Wikipedia project to search in.
info-scope-location: Focus your search within specific article titles, categories, or pages linked from other articles.
info-intitle-text: Searches the Main Search Query only in the title of the article.
info-prefix-value-text: Find pages whose titles begin with the specified text.
info-incategory-text: Searches for articles within one or more categories. Separate multiple categories with a pipe character (|).
info-deepcat-text: Searches for articles in the specified category and its subcategories.
info-linkfrom-text: Finds pages that link to the specified page.
info-category-dropdown-text: Select one of the major categories. For specific categories, use the 'In Category' field above.
info-content-technical: Target articles based on their internal wikitext content, templates they use, or properties of associated files.
info-insource-text: Searches for terms or regular expressions directly in the wikitext.
info-hastemplate-text: Searches pages using the specified template.
info-filetype-text: Filters media files by their type (e.g., pdf, jpg, svg).
info-date-filters: Filter articles by the page's creation or last modification date on Wikipedia. Format: YYYY-MM-DD.
info-filesize-text: Filters media files by their size. Use Min and Max for a range.
generated-string-placeholder: The generated string will appear here.
explanation-intitle: Search for pages with "{mainQuery}" specifically in their title.
explanation-main-query: Search for pages containing the terms "{mainQuery}".
explanation-fuzzy-applied: Applying fuzzy search to "{mainQuery}" to include similar terms.
explanation-wildcard-applied: Applying wildcard search to "{mainQuery}" (find word parts).
explanation-without-words: Excluding pages that contain any of these words: "{withoutWords}".
explanation-any-words: Including pages with at least one of these words: "{anyWords}".
explanation-incategory: Restricting results to articles within the category "{inCategory}".
explanation-deepcat: Restricting results to articles within "{deepCat}" and its subcategories.
explanation-prefix: Showing only pages whose titles start with "{prefixValue}".
explanation-insource: Searching for pages that contain "{insource}" in their wikitext source.
explanation-hastemplate: Including pages that use the template "{hastemplate}".
explanation-filesize-min: Including files with a size greater than or equal to {fileSizeMin} bytes.
explanation-filesize-max: Including files with a size less than or equal to {fileSizeMax} bytes.
timeline-explanation: This timeline shows the search results based on their last modification date.
timeline-no-data: No date information available for these results.
alert-analyze-first: Please run Network Analysis first to calculate relevance scores.
footer-disclaimer: This project is not affiliated with the Wikimedia Foundation. All search results are sourced from Wikipedia and licensed under CC BY-SA 3.0.
faq-a1: WikiGUI is a web-based tool that assists users in building complex search queries for Wikipedia by providing an intuitive interface for various search parameters.
faq-a2: WikiGUI is provided under an open license. Basic use is free. Please refer to the license files for details.
faq-q3: Do I need to install anything to use WikiGUI?
faq-a3: No, WikiGUI is a web application. You can use it directly from your web browser without any installation.
faq-q4: How does the 'All these words' field work?
faq-a4: Entering terms in the 'All these words' field means all of them must be present in the search results.
faq-q5: How does the category dropdown work?
faq-a5: The 'Category' dropdown allows you to select a predefined Wikipedia category to pre-fill the search parameter.
faq-q9: According to what logic are the search results generated?
faq-a9: The search follows a two-step process: First, WikiGUI translates your input into complex Wikipedia search syntax (Boolean logic like AND, OR, exclusions). Then, Wikipedia's search engine (CirrusSearch) takes over the ranking. Hits in the title are weighted higher than those in the text. Word proximity and article popularity are also considered to show you the most relevant results first.
faq-q6: Why should I use Wikipedia when I can ask AI (like ChatGPT)?
faq-a6: AI models can 'hallucinate' (invent facts). Wikipedia provides transparency through citations. WikiGUI also allows for targeted metadata searches (file types, dates) which AI cannot do.
faq-q7: What is the advantage of WikiGUI over a simple AI answer?
faq-a7: WikiGUI treats Wikipedia like a database. You can search for specific original sources (like PDFs), while AI usually only provides a summary.
faq-q8: How do I report a bug or ask a question?
faq-a8: Use the 'Report an Issue' link in the footer. This will take you to our GitHub Issues page.
preset-history-world-wars-query: World War I World War II
preset-history-world-wars-any-words: Treaty of Versailles Battle Peace Treaty
saved-searches-heading: Saved Searches (Local, temporary storage only. Export for permanent saving)
save-search-comment-placeholder: Add a comment for this search (optional)
alert-generate-search-string: Please generate a search string first before saving.
alert-search-already-saved: This exact search (query and comment) is already saved!
confirm-delete-search: Are you sure you want to delete this saved search?
alert-unsupported-file-type: Unsupported file type. Please select a .json or .csv file.
alert-date-invalid: The start date cannot be later than the end date.
cookie-text: We use cookies to give you the best experience and to support the app via advertising (AdSense).
confirm-clear-journal: Are you sure you want to clear your entire search journal?
history-edit-prompt: Enter a new name for this entry:
no-history: Your journal is empty. Start a search!
params-modal-current-example: Current Special:Search URL (how parameters are serialized):
param-search-desc: Primary search terms. Multiple 'search' parameters may be used; quoted phrases and operators are supported. In Special:Search they often appear as repeated 'search=...' parameters.
param-exact-desc: Exact phrase search. Quoted phrases are sent as 'search="phrase"', e.g. search="red planet".
param-without-desc: Exclude words by prefixing them with a minus sign (e.g., -rover). These are appended as 'search=-word'.
param-any-desc: OR groups. Use parenthesis or 'OR' between terms. Serialized into the 'search' parameter, e.g. search=(exploration OR mission).
param-intitle-desc: Restricts match to article titles only. Appears as 'intitle=...' instead of 'search=...'.
param-incategory-desc: Limits results to a category; multiple categories can be provided and are sent as repeated 'incategory' parameters, e.g. incategory=Space+travel.
param-deepcat-desc: Searches within a category and its subcategories; appears as 'deepcat=CategoryName'.
param-prefix-desc: Filters pages whose title starts with a given string, e.g. 'prefix=Science:'.
param-linkfrom-desc: Finds pages that link from a specific page; appears as 'linkfrom=Page+Title'.
param-insource-desc: Search inside the wikitext source; supports regex or text, e.g., insource:/regex/ or insource:"text".
param-hastemplate-desc: Find pages that use a particular template; appears as 'hastemplate=Template+Name'.
param-filetype-desc: Filter by file types; combined in Special:Search as 'filetype=pdf|jpg'.
param-filesize-desc: File size constraints are represented in the search string, e.g., 'filesize:>=1024' and may be appended to 'search'.
param-date-desc: Date filters for pages added/modified, in YYYY-MM-DD format, e.g., dateafter=2020-01-01.
param-ns-desc: Namespace filters are sent as nsX=1 (e.g., ns0=1 for main/article namespace).
network-explanation-intro: Analysis Result: Out of {total} analyzed articles, {connected} show direct thematic links. A total of {edges} connections were identified.
network-explanation-interpretation: Interpretation: The lines represent shared Wikipedia categories or significant keyword overlaps. Thicker and brighter lines indicate stronger relationships.
network-explanation-central: Central Topic: "{title}" has the strongest connections in this set.
network-explanation-note: Note: The analysis is based on article metadata. Large nodes indicate "bridge topics" that connect many sub-fields.
params-modal-intro: This panel explains all parameters you can use with Special:Search. Use the form to generate a URL or paste a Special:Search URL to see a parameter breakdown.
error-api-fetch: Could not fetch data from Wikipedia API.
health-card-desc: Overall article quality rating based on citations and media density.
health-card-tooltip: Structural integrity: Evaluates reference ratio, image density, and formal correctness. A score > 70 indicates high reliability.
drift-card-desc: Detects content deviations between the introduction and the main body.
drift-card-tooltip: AI Vector Analysis: Checks if the main section deviates thematically from the intro. High drift indicates inconsistency.
map-card-desc: Geographical distribution of the identified articles in space.
